block.p: Suzanne Gilbert Pillsbury, a freelance film editor, and Mark Trottenberg, a cameraman and director, were married on Friday. The Rev. Susan Elmiger, an interfaith minister, performed the ceremony at Bargemusic in Brooklyn.

Ms. Pillsbury, who is keeping her name, was an editor of the HBO mini-series ''The Corner,'' broadcast in April. She graduated from Brown University and studied film production at New York University. She is a daughter of the late Dr. and Mrs. Philip Pillsbury. Her father was an internist in San Francisco.

Mr. Trottenberg was the director of photography for ''Molly's Pilgrim,'' which won an Academy Award for best live-action short film in 1986, and he directed ''Roy Lichtenstein: Tokyo Brushstrokes,'' a 1995 documentary. He graduated from New York University. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur D. Trottenberg of Cambridge, Mass. His father, who is retired, was the vice president for administration at the Ford Foundation in New York.
